qas.question: What are the two most powerful political parties in the United States?

answers.text: Democratic Party and the Republican Party

qas.question: Name a nation that has a one-party political system.
How are political parties elected in democracies?
What are some countries that have multiple powerful political parties?
What did China have when its government was first founded?
What are the differences in the way people vote in China compared to other countries?
Where does the ideology of China's main political parties come from?
What is the main purpose changing an ideology after a government is founded?
What is one thing Germany and India have changed after their governments were founded?

context: While there is some <b4_0>international commonality<b4_0/> in the way political parties are recognized, and in how they operate, there are often many differences, and some are <b5_0>significant<b5_0/>. Many political parties have an ideological core, but some do not, and many represent very different <b8_0>ideologies<b8_0/> than they did when first founded. In democracies, political parties are elected by <a2_0><b6_0>the electorate<b6_0/><a2_0/> <b7_0>to run a government<b7_0/>. Many countries have numerous powerful political parties, such as <a3_0>Germany and India<a3_0/> and some nations have one-party systems, such as <a1_0>China<a1_0/>. The United States is a two-party system, with its two most powerful parties being the <a0_0>Democratic Party and the Republican Party<a0_0/>.
